monster.name: Acid Burrower
monster.description: A horse-sized insect with digging claws and acidic blood.

entry.name: Relentless (3)
entry.description: The Burrower can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Earth Eruption
entry.description: Mark a Stress to have the Burrower burst out of the ground. All creatures within Very Close range must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or be knocked over, making them Vulnerable until they next act.

entry.name: Spit Acid
entry.description: Make an attack against all targets in front of the Burrower within Close range. Targets the Burrower succeeds against take 2d6 physical damage and must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP and you gain a Fear.

monster.name: Bear
monster.description: A large bear with thick fur and powerful claws.

entry.name: Overwhelming Force
entry.description: Targets who mark HP from the Bear’s standard attack are knocked back to Very Close range.

entry.name: Bite
entry.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal 3d4+10 physical damage and the target is Restrained until they break free with a successful Strength Roll.

monster.name: Cave Ogre
monster.description: A massive humanoid who sees all sapient life as food.
monster.motives: Bite off heads, feast, rip limbs, stomp, throw enemies

entry.name: Ramp Up
entry.description: You must spend a Fear to spotlight the Ogre. While spotlighted, they can make their standard attack against all targets within range.

entry.name: Bone Breaker
entry.description: The Ogre’s attacks deal direct damage.

entry.name: Hail of Boulders
entry.description: Mark a Stress to pick up heavy objects and throw them at all targets in front of the Ogre within Far range. Make an attack against these targets. Targets the Ogre succeeds against take 1d10+2 physical damage. If they succeed against more than one target, you gain a Fear.

monster.name: Construct
monster.description: A roughly humanoid being of stone and steel, assembled and animated by magic.
monster.motives: Destroy environment, serve creator, smash target, trample groups

entry.name: Relentless (2)
entry.description: The Construct can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Weak Structure
entry.description: When the Construct marks HP from physical damage, they must mark an additional HP.

entry.name: Trample
entry.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against all targets in the Construct’s path when they move. Targets the Construct succeeds against take 1d8 physical damage.

entry.name: Overload
entry.description: Before rolling damage for the Construct’s attack, you can mark a Stress to gain a +10 bonus to the damage roll. The Construct can then take the spotlight again.

monster.name: Courtier
monster.description: An ambitious and ostentatiously dressed socialite.

entry.name: Mockery
entry.description: Mark a Stress to say something mocking and force a target within Close range to make a Presence Reaction Roll (14) to see if they can save face. On a failure, the target must mark 2 Stress and is Vulnerable until the scene ends.

monster.name: Deeproot Defender
monster.description: A burly vegetable-person with grasping vines.

entry.name: Ground Slam
entry.description: Slam the ground, knocking all targets within Very Close range back to Far range. Each target knocked back by this must mark a Stress.

monster.name: Dire Wolf
monster.description: A large wolf with menacing teeth, seldom encountered alone.
monster.motives: Defend territory, harry, protect pack, surround, trail

entry.name: Pack Tactics
entry.description: If the Wolf makes a successful standard attack and another Dire Wolf is within Melee range of the target, deal 1d6+5 physical damage instead of their standard damage and you gain a Fear.

monster.name: Giant Mosquitoes
monster.description: Dozens of fist-sized mosquitoes, flying together for protection.

entry.name: Horde (1d4+1)
entry.description: When the Mosquitoes have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d4+1 physical damage instead.

entry.name: Flying
entry.description: While flying, the Mosquitoes have a +2 bonus to their Difficulty.

monster.name: Giant Rat
monster.description: A cat-sized rodent skilled at scavenging and survival.

entry.name: Minion (3)
entry.description: The Rat is defeated when they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to the Rat, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

monster.name: Giant Scorpion
monster.description: A human-sized insect with tearing claws and a stinging tail.

entry.name: Double Strike
entry.description: Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against two targets within Melee range.

entry.name: Venomous Stinger
entry.description: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, spend a Fear to deal 1d4+4 physical damage and Poison them until their next rest or they succeed on a Knowledge Roll (16). While Poisoned, the target must roll a d6 before they make an action roll. On a result of 4 or lower, they must mark a Stress.

monster.name: Glass Snake
monster.description: A clear serpent with a massive head that leaves behind a glass shard trail wherever they go.

entry.name: Armor-Shredding Shards
entry.description: On a successful attack within Melee range against the Snake, the attacker must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

entry.name: Spinning Serpent
entry.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Snake succeeds against take 1d6+1 physical damage.

monster.name: Harrier
monster.description: A nimble fighter armed with javelins.

entry.name: Maintain Distance
entry.description: After making a standard attack, the Harrier can move anywhere within Far range.

monster.name: Archer Guard
monster.description: A tall guard bearing a longbow and quiver with arrows fletched in the settlement’s colors.
monster.motives: Arrest, close gates, make it through the day, pin down

monster.name: Bladed Guard
monster.description: An armored guard bearing a sword and shield painted in the settlement’s colors.
monster.motives: Arrest, close gates, make it through the day, pin down

entry.name: Shield Wall
entry.description: A creature who tries to move within Very Close range of the Guard must succeed on an Agility Roll. If additional Bladed Guards are standing in a line alongside the first, and each is within Melee range of another guard in the line, the Difficulty increases by the total number of guards in the line.

monster.name: Head Guard
monster.description: A seasoned guard with a mace, a whistle, and a bellowing voice.
monster.motives: Arrest, close gates, pin down, seek glory

entry.name: Rally Guards
entry.description: Spend 2 Fear to spotlight the Head Guard and up to 2d4 allies within Far range.

entry.name: On My Signal
entry.description: Countdown (5). When the Head Guard is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. It ticks down when a PC makes an attack roll. When it triggers, all Archer Guards within Far range make a standard attack with advantage against the nearest target within their range. If any attacks succeed on the same target, combine their damage.

monster.name: Jagged Knife Bandit
monster.description: A cunning criminal in a cloak bearing one of the gang’s iconic knives.

entry.name: Climber
entry.description: The Bandit climbs just as easily as they run.

monster.name: Jagged Knife Hexer
monster.description: A staff-wielding bandit in a cloak adorned with magical paraphernalia, using curses to vex their foes.

entry.name: Curse
entry.description: Choose a target within Far range and temporarily Curse them. While the target is Cursed, you can mark a Stress so that target rolls with Hope to make the roll be with Fear instead.

monster.name: Jagged Knife Kneebreaker
monster.description: An imposing brawler carrying a large club.

entry.name: I’ve Got ‘Em
entry.description: Creatures Restrained by the Kneebreaker take double damage from attacks by other adversaries.

monster.name: Jagged Knife Lackey
monster.description: A thief with simple clothes and small daggers, eager to prove themselves.

entry.name: Minion (3)
entry.description: The Lackey is defeated when they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to the Lackey, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

monster.name: Jagged Knife Lieutenant
monster.description: A seasoned bandit in quality leathers with a strong voice and cunning eyes.

entry.name: Tactician
entry.description: When you spotlight the Lieutenant, mark a Stress to also spotlight two allies within Close range.

entry.name: More Where That Came From
entry.description: Summon three Jagged Knife Lackeys, who appear at Far range.

entry.name: Coup de Grace
entry.description: Spend a Fear to make an attack against a Vulnerable target within Close range. On a success, deal 2d6+12 physical damage and the target must mark a Stress.

monster.name: Jagged Knife Shadow
monster.description: A nimble scoundrel bearing a wicked knife and utilizing shadow magic to isolate targets.

entry.name: Backstab
entry.description: When the Shadow succeeds on a standard attack that has advantage, they deal 1d6+6 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

monster.name: Jagged Knife Sniper
monster.description: A lanky bandit striking from cover with a shortbow.

monster.name: Merchant
monster.description: A finely dressed trader with a keen eye for financial gain.
monster.motives: Buy low and sell high, create demand, inflate prices, seek profit

entry.name: Preferential Treatment
entry.description: A PC who succeeds on a Presence Roll against the Merchant gains a discount on purchases. A PC who fails on a Presence Roll against the Merchant must pay more and has disadvantage on future Presence Rolls against the Merchant.

monster.name: Minor Chaos Elemental
monster.description: A coruscating mass of uncontrollable magic.

entry.name: Arcane Master
entry.description: The Elemental is resistant to magic damage.

entry.name: Sickening Flux
entry.description: Mark a HP to force all targets within Close range to mark a Stress and become Vulnerable until their next rest or they clear a HP.

entry.name: Remake Reality
entry.description: Spend a Fear to transform the area within Very Close range into a different biome. All targets within this area take 2d6+3 direct magic damage.

entry.name: Magical Reflection
entry.description: When the Elemental takes damage from an attack within Close range, deal an amount of damage to the attacker equal to half of the damage they dealt.

monster.name: Minor Fire Elemental
monster.description: A living flame the size of a large bonfire.
monster.motives: Encircle enemies, grow in size, intimidate, start fires

entry.name: Relentless (2)
entry.description: The Elemental can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Scorched Earth
entry.description: Mark a Stress to choose a point within Far range. The ground within Very Close range of that point immediately bursts into flames. All creatures within this area must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 2d8 magic damage from the flames. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entry.name: Explosion
entry.description: Spend a Fear to erupt in a fiery explosion. Make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Elemental succeeds against take 1d8 magic damage and are knocked back to Far range.

entry.name: Consume Kindling
entry.description: Three times per scene, when the Elemental moves on objects that are highly flammable, consume them to clear a HP or a Stress.

monster.name: Minor Demon
monster.description: A crimson-hued creature from the Circles Below, consumed by rage against all mortals.
monster.motives: Act erratically, corral targets, relish pain, torment

entry.name: Relentless (2)
entry.description: The Demon can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: All Must Fall
entry.description: When a PC rolls a failure with Fear while within Close range of the Demon, they lose a Hope.

entry.name: Hellfire
entry.description: Spend a Fear to rain down hellfire within Far range. All targets within the area must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 1d20+3 magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entry.name: Reaper
entry.description: Before rolling damage for the Demon’s attack, you can mark a Stress to gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to the Demon’s current number of marked HP.

monster.name: Minor Treant
monster.description: An ambulatory sapling rising up to defend their forest.

entry.name: Minion (5)
entry.description: The Treant is defeated when they take any damage. For every 5 damage a PC deals to the Treant, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

monster.name: Green Ooze
monster.description: A moving mound of translucent green slime.
monster.motives: Camouflage, consume and multiply, creep up, envelop

entry.name: Slow
entry.description: When you spotlight the Ooze and they don’t have a token on their stat block, they can’t act. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they’re preparing to do. When you spotlight the Ooze and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

entry.name: Acidic Form
entry.description: When the Ooze makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

entry.name: Envelope
entry.description: Make a standard attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, the Ooze envelops them and the target must mark 2 Stress. The target must mark an additional Stress when they make an action roll. If the Ooze takes Severe damage, the target is freed.

monster.name: Tiny Green Ooze
monster.description: A small moving mound of translucent green slime.

monster.name: Red Ooze
monster.description: A moving mound of translucent flaming red slime.
monster.motives: Camouflage, consume and multiply, ignite, start fires

entry.name: Creeping Fire
entry.description: The Ooze can only move within Very Close range as their normal movement. They light any flammable object they touch on fire.

entry.name: Ignite
entry.description: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, the target takes 1d8 magic damage and is ignited until they’re extinguished with a successful Finesse Roll (14). While ignited, the target takes 1d4 magic damage when they make an action roll.

monster.name: Tiny Red Ooze
monster.description: A small moving mound of translucent flaming red slime.

monster.name: Petty Noble
monster.description: A richly dressed and adorned aristocrat brimming with hubris.
monster.motives: Abuse power, gather resources, mobilize minions

entry.name: My Land, My Rules
entry.description: All social actions made against the Noble on their land have disadvantage.

entry.name: Guards, Seize Them!
entry.description: Once per scene, mark a Stress to summon 1d4 Bladed Guards, who appear at Far range to enforce the Noble’s will.

monster.name: Pirate Captain
monster.description: A charismatic sea dog with an impressive hat, eager to raid and plunder.
monster.motives: Command, make 'em walk the plank, plunder, raid

entry.name: Swashbuckler
entry.description: When the Captain marks 2 or fewer HP from an attack within Melee range, the attacker must mark a Stress.

entry.name: Reinforcements
entry.description: Once per scene, mark a Stress to summon a Pirate Raiders Horde, which appears at Far range.

entry.name: No Quarter
entry.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target who has three or more Pirates within Melee range of them. The Captain leads the Pirates in hurling threats and promises of a watery grave. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll. On a failure, the target marks 1d4+1 Stress. On a success, they must mark a Stress.

monster.name: Pirate Raiders
monster.description: Seafaring scoundrels moving in a ravaging pack.

entry.name: Horde (1d4+1)
entry.description: When the Raiders have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d4+1 physical damage instead.

monster.name: Pirate Tough
monster.description: A thickly muscled and tattooed pirate with melon-sized fists.

entry.name: Swashbuckler
entry.description: When the Tough marks 2 or fewer HP from an attack within Melee range, the attacker must mark a Stress.

monster.name: Sellsword
monster.description: An armed mercenary testing their luck.

entry.name: Minion (4)
entry.description: The Sellsword is defeated when they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to the Sellsword, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

monster.name: Skeleton Archer
monster.description: A fragile skeleton with a shortbow and arrows.
monster.motives: Perforate distracted targets, play dead, steal skin

entry.name: Opportunist
entry.description: When two or more adversaries are within Very Close range of a creature, all damage they each deal to that creature is doubled.

monster.name: Skeleton Dredge
monster.description: A clattering pile of bones.
monster.motives: Fall apart, overwhelm, play dead, steal skin

entry.name: Minion (4)
entry.description: The Dredge is defeated when they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to the Dredge, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

monster.name: Skeleton Knight
monster.description: A large armored skeleton with a huge blade.
monster.motives: Cut down the living, steal skin, wreak havoc

entry.name: Terrifying
entry.description: When the Knight makes a successful attack, all PCs within Close range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

entry.name: Cut to the Bone
entry.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Knight succeeds against take 1d8+2 physical damage and must mark a Stress.

monster.name: Skeleton Warrior
monster.description: A dirt-covered skeleton armed with a rusted blade.
monster.motives: Feign death, gang up, steal skin

entry.name: Only Bones
entry.description: The Warrior is resistant to physical damage.

monster.name: Spellblade
monster.description: A mercenary combining swordplay and magic to deadly effect.

entry.name: Arcane Steel
entry.description: Damage dealt by the Spellblade’s standard attack is considered both physical and magic.

entry.name: Suppressing Blast
entry.description: Mark a Stress and target a group within Far range. All targets must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take 1d8+2 magic damage. You gain a Fear for each target who marked HP from this attack.

entry.name: Move as Unit
entry.description: Spend 2 Fear to spotlight up to five allies within Far range.

monster.name: Swarm Of Rats
monster.description: A skittering mass of ordinary rodents moving as one like a ravenous wave.

entry.name: Horde (1d4+1)
entry.description: When the Swarm has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d4+1 physical damage instead.

monster.name: Sylvan Soldier
monster.description: A faerie warrior adorned in armor made of leaves and bark.

entry.name: Pack Tactics
entry.description: If the Soldier makes a standard attack and another Sylvan Soldier is within Melee range of the target, deal 1d8+5 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

entry.name: Forest Control
entry.description: Spend a Fear to pull down a tree within Close range. A creature hit by the tree must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll (15) or take 1d10 physical damage.

monster.name: Tangle Bramble Swarm
monster.description: A cluster of animated, blood-drinking tumbleweeds, each the size of a large gourd.

entry.name: Horde (1d4+2)
entry.description: When the Swarm has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d4+2 physical damage instead.

entry.name: Crush
entry.description: Mark a Stress to deal 2d6+8 direct physical damage to a target with 3 or more bramble tokens.

monster.name: Tangle Bramble
monster.description: An animate, blood-drinking tumbleweed.

entry.name: Minion (4)
entry.description: The Bramble is defeated when they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to the Tangle Bramble, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

entry.name: Group Attack
entry.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Tangle Brambles within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 2 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

monster.name: Weaponmaster
monster.description: A master-at-arms wielding a sword twice their size.
monster.motives: Act first, aim for the weakest, intimidate

entry.name: Goading Strike
entry.description: Make a standard attack against a target. On a success, mark a Stress to Taunt the target until their next successful attack. The next time the Taunted target attacks, they have disadvantage against targets other than the Weaponmaster.

entry.name: Adrenaline Burst
entry.description: Once per scene, spend a Fear to clear 2 HP and 2 Stress.

monster.name: Brawny Zombie
monster.description: A large corpse, decay-bloated and angry.

entry.name: Slow
entry.description: When you spotlight the Zombie and they don’t have a token on their stat block, they can’t act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they’re preparing to do. When you spotlight the Zombie and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

entry.name: Rend Asunder
entry.description: Make a standard attack with advantage against a target the Zombie has Restrained. On a success, the attack deals direct damage.

monster.name: Young Dryad
monster.description: An imperious tree-person leading their forest’s defenses.

entry.name: Voice of the Forest
entry.description: Mark a Stress to spotlight 1d4 allies within range of a target they can attack without moving. On a success, their attacks deal half damage.

entry.name: Thorny Cage
entry.description: Spend a Fear to form a cage around a target within Very Close range and Restrain them until they’re freed with a successful Strength Roll. When a creature makes an action roll against the cage, they must mark a Stress.

monster.name: Patchwork Zombie Hulk
monster.description: A towering gestalt of corpses moving as one, with torso-sized limbs and fists as large as a grown halfling.

entry.name: Destructive
entry.description: When the Zombie takes Major or greater damage, they mark an additional HP.

entry.name: Flailing Limbs
entry.description: When the Zombie makes a standard attack, they can attack all targets within Very Close range.

entry.name: Another for the Pile
entry.description: When the Zombie is within Very Close range of a corpse, they can incorporate it into themselves, clearing a HP and a Stress.

monster.name: Rotted Zombie
monster.description: A decaying corpse ambling toward their prey.

entry.name: Minion (3)
entry.description: The Zombie is defeated when they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to the Zombie, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

monster.name: Shambling Zombie
monster.description: An animated corpse that moves shakily, driven only by hunger.
monster.motives: Devour, hungry, mob enemy, shred flesh

entry.name: Too Many to Handle
entry.description: When the Zombie is within Melee range of a creature and at least one other Zombie is within Close range, all attacks against that creature have advantage.

monster.name: Zombie Pack
monster.description: A group of shambling corpses instinctively moving together.

entry.name: Horde (1d4+2)
entry.description: When the Zombies have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d4+2 physical damage instead.

monster.name: Archer Squadron
monster.description: A group of trained archers bearing massive bows.

entry.name: Horde (1d6+3)
entry.description: When the Squadron has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d6+3 physical damage instead.

entry.name: Focused Volley
entry.description: Spend a Fear to target a point within Far range. Make an attack with advantage against all targets within Close range of that point. Targets the Squadron succeeds against take 1d10+4 physical damage.

monster.name: Assassin Poisoner
monster.description: A cunning scoundrel skilled in both poisons and ambushing.
monster.motives: Anticipate, get paid, kill, taint food and water

entry.name: Grindeloth Venom
entry.description: Targets who mark HP from the Assassin’s attacks are Vulnerable until they clear a HP.

entry.name: Out of Nowhere
entry.description: The Assassin has advantage on attacks if they are Hidden.

monster.name: Apprentice Assassin
monster.description: A young trainee eager to prove themselves.
monster.motives: Act reckless, kill, prove their worth, show off

entry.name: Minion (6)
entry.description: The Assassin is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Assassin, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

monster.name: Master Assassin
monster.description: A seasoned killer with a threatening voice and a deadly blade.
monster.motives: Ambush, get out alive, kill, prepare for all scenarios

entry.name: Won’t See It Coming
entry.description: The Assassin deals direct damage while they’re Hidden.

entry.name: Strike as One
entry.description: Mark a Stress to spotlight a number of other Assassins equal to the Assassin’s unmarked Stress.

entry.name: The Subtle Blade
entry.description: When the Assassin successfully makes a standard attack against a Vulnerable target, you can spend a Fear to deal Severe damage instead of their standard damage.

monster.name: Battle Box
monster.description: A cube-shaped construct with a different rune on each of their six sides.
monster.motives: Change tactics, trample foes, wait in disguise

entry.name: Relentless (2)
entry.description: The Box can be spotlighted up to two times per turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Randomized Tactics
entry.description: Mark a Stress and roll a d6. The Box uses the corresponding move: 1. Mana Beam: The Box fires a searing beam. Make an attack against a target within Far range. On a success, deal 2d10+2 magic damage. 2. Fire Jets: The Box shoots into the air, spinning and releasing jets of flame. Make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Box succeeds against take 2d8 physical damage. 3. Trample: The Box rockets around erratically. Make an attack against all PCs within Close range. Targets the Box succeeds against take 1d6+5 physical damage and are Vulnerable until their next roll with Hope. 4. Shocking Gas: The Box sprays out a silver gas sparking with lightning. All targets within Close range must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll or mark 3 Stress. 5. Stunning Clap: The Box leaps and their sides clap, creating a concussive boom. All targets within Very Close range must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll or become Vulnerable until the cube is defeated. 6. Psonic Whine: The Box releases a cluster of mechanical bees whose buzz rattles mortal minds. All targets within Close range must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll or take 2d4+9 direct magic damage.

entry.name: Overcharge
entry.description: Before rolling damage for the Box’s attack, you can mark a Stress to add a d6 to the damage roll. Additionally, you gain a Fear.

monster.name: Chaos Skull
monster.description: A floating humanoid skull animated by scintillating magic.

entry.name: Levitation
entry.description: The Skull levitates several feet off the ground and can’t be Restrained.

entry.name: Wards
entry.description: The Skull is resistant to magic damage.

entry.name: Magic Burst
entry.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Skull succeeds against take 2d6+4 magic damage.

monster.name: Conscript
monster.description: A poorly trained civilian pressed into war.

entry.name: Minion (6)
entry.description: The Conscript is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Conscript, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

monster.name: Courtesan
monster.description: An accomplished manipulator and master of the social arts.

monster.name: Cult Adept
monster.description: An experienced mage wielding shadow and fear.
monster.motives: Curry favor, hinder foes, uncover knowledge

entry.name: Enervating Blast
entry.description: Spend a Fear to make a standard attack against a target within range. On a success, the target must mark a Stress.

entry.name: Shroud of the Fallen
entry.description: Mark a Stress to wrap an ally within Close range in a shroud of Protection until the Adept marks their last HP. While Protected, the target has resistance to all damage.

entry.name: Shadow Shackles
entry.description: Spend a Fear and choose a point within Far range. All targets within Close range of that point are Restrained in smoky chains until they break free with a successful Strength or Instinct Roll. A target Restrained by this feature must spend a Hope to make an action roll.

monster.name: Cult Fang
monster.description: A professional killer-turned-cultist.
monster.motives: Capture sacrifices, isolate prey, rise in the ranks

entry.name: Shadow’s Embrace
entry.description: The Fang can climb and walk on vertical surfaces. Mark a Stress to move from one shadow to another within Far range.

monster.name: Cult Initiate
monster.description: A low-ranking cultist in simple robes, eager to gain power.
monster.motives: Follow orders, gain power, seek forbidden knowledge

entry.name: Minion (6)
entry.description: The Initiate is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Initiate, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

monster.name: Demonic Hound Pack
monster.description: Unnatural hounds lit from within by hellfire.
monster.motives: Cause fear, consume flesh, please masters

entry.name: Horde (2d4+1)
entry.description: When the Pack has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 2d4+1 physical damage instead.

entry.name: Dreadhowl
entry.description: Mark a Stress to make all targets within Very Close range lose a Hope. If a target is not able to lose a Hope, they must instead mark 2 Stress.

monster.name: Electric Eels
monster.description: A swarm of eels that encircle and electrocute.
monster.motives: Avoid larger predators, shock prey, tear apart

entry.name: Horde (2d4+1)
entry.description: When the Eels have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 2d4+1 physical damage instead.

monster.name: Elite Soldier
monster.description: An armored squire or experienced commoner looking to advance.
monster.motives: Gain glory, keep order, make alliances

entry.name: Reinforce
entry.description: Mark a Stress to move into Melee range of an ally and make a standard attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal 2d10+2 physical damage and the ally can clear a Stress.

monster.name: Failed Experiment
monster.description: A magical necromantic experiment gone wrong, leaving them warped and ungainly.

entry.name: Warped Fortitude
entry.description: The Experiment is resistant to physical damage.

entry.name: Overwhelm
entry.description: When a target the Experiment attacks has other adversaries within Very Close range, the Experiment deals double damage.

monster.name: Giant Beastmaster
monster.description: A leather-clad warrior bearing a whip and massive bow.
monster.motives: Command, make a living, maneuver, pin down, protect companion animals

entry.name: Two as One
entry.description: When the Beastmaster is spotlighted, you can also spotlight a Tier 1 animal adversary currently under their control.

entry.name: Pinning Strike
entry.description: Make a standard attack against a target. On a success, you can mark a Stress to pin them to a nearby surface. The pinned target is Restrained until they break free with a successful Finesse or Strength Roll.

monster.name: Giant Brawler
monster.description: An especially muscular giant wielding a warhammer larger than a human.
monster.motives: Make a living, overwhelm, slam, topple

entry.name: Battering Ram
entry.description: Mark a Stress to have the Brawler charge at an inanimate object within Close range they could feasibly smash (such as a wall, cart, or market stand) and destroy it. All targets within Very Close range of the object must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take 2d4+3 physical damage from the shrapnel.

entry.name: Bloody Reprisal
entry.description: When the Brawler marks 2 or more HP from an attack within Very Close range, you can make a standard attack against the attacker. On a success, the Brawler deals 2d6+15 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

monster.name: Giant Eagle
monster.description: A giant bird of prey with blood-stained talons.
monster.motives: Hunt prey, stay mobile, strike decisively

entry.name: Flight
entry.description: While flying, the Eagle gains a +3 bonus to their Difficulty.

entry.name: Deadly Dive
entry.description: Mark a Stress to attack a target within Far range. On a success, deal 2d10+2 physical damage and knock the target over, making them Vulnerable until they next act.

entry.name: Take Off
entry.description: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal 2d4+3 physical damage and the target must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or become temporarily Restrained within the Eagle’s massive talons. If the target is Restrained, the Eagle immediately lifts them to the air to Very Far range above the battlefield while holding them.

monster.name: Giant Recruit
monster.description: A giant fighter undergoing borrowed armor.
monster.motives: Batter, make a living, overwhelm, terrify

entry.name: Minion (7)
entry.description: The Recruit is defeated when they take any damage. For every 7 damage a PC deals to the Recruit, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

monster.name: Gorgon
monster.description: A snake-headed, scaled humanoid with a gilded bow, enraged that their peace has been disturbed.

entry.name: Relentless (2)
entry.description: The Gorgon can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Suneater Arrows
entry.description: When the Gorgon makes a successful standard attack, the target Glows until the end of the scene and can’t become Hidden. Attack rolls made against a Glowing target have advantage.

entry.name: Crown of Serpents
entry.description: Make an attack roll against a target within Melee range using the Gorgon’s protective snakes. On a success, mark Stress to deal 2d10+4 physical damage and the target must mark a Stress.

entry.name: Petrifying Gaze
entry.description: When the Gorgon takes damage from an attack within Close range, you can spend a Fear to force the attacker to make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, they begin to turn to stone, marking a HP and starting a Petrification Countdown (4). This countdown ticks down when the Gorgon is attacked. When it triggers, the target must make a death move. If the Gorgon is defeated, all petrification countdowns end.

monster.name: Juvenile Flickerfly
monster.description: A horse-sized insect with iridescent scales and crystalline wings moving faster than the eye can see.

entry.name: Relentless (3)
entry.description: The Flickerfly can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Peerless Accuracy
entry.description: Before the Flickerfly makes an attack, roll a d6. On a result of 4 or higher, the target’s Evasion is halved against this attack.

entry.name: Mind Dance
entry.description: Mark a Stress to create a magically dazzling display that grapples the minds of nearby foes. All targets within Close range must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. For each target who failed, you gain a Fear and the Flickerfly learns one of the target’s fears.

monster.name: Knight Of The Realm
monster.description: A decorated soldier with heavy armor and a powerful steed.
monster.motives: Run down, seek glory, show dominance

entry.name: Chevalier
entry.description: While the Knight is on a mount, they gain a +2 bonus to their Difficulty. When they take Severe damage, they’re knocked from their mount and lose this benefit until they’re next spotlighted.

entry.name: Heavily Armored
entry.description: When the Knight takes physical damage, reduce it by 3.

entry.name: Cavalry Charge
entry.description: If the Knight is mounted, move up to Far range and make a standard attack against a target. On a success, deal 2d8+4 physical damage and the target must mark a Stress.

monster.name: Masked Thief
monster.description: A cunning thief with acrobatic skill and a flair for the dramatic.

entry.name: Quick Hands
entry.description: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal 1d8+2 physical damage and the Thief steals one item or consumable from the target’s inventory.

monster.name: Merchant Baron
monster.description: An accomplished merchant with a large operation under their command.
monster.motives: Abusive power, gather resources, mobilize minions

entry.name: Everyone Has a Price
entry.description: Spend a Fear to offer a target a dangerous bargain for something they want or need. If used on a PC, they must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17). On a failure, they must mark 2 Stress or take the deal.

monster.name: Minotaur Wrecker
monster.description: A massive bull-headed hybrid with a quick temper.

entry.name: Ramp Up
entry.description: You must spend a Fear to spotlight the Minotaur. While spotlighted, they can make their standard attack against all targets within range.

entry.name: Charging Bull
entry.description: Mark a Stress to charge through a group within Close range and make an attack against all targets in the Minotaur’s path. Targets the Minotaur succeeds against take 2d6+8 physical damage and are knocked back to Very Far range. If a target is knocked into a solid object or another creature, they take an extra 1d6 damage (combine their damage).

monster.name: Mortal Hunter
monster.description: An undead figure wearing a heavy leather coat, with searching eyes and a cruelly cut demeanor.

entry.name: Terrifying
entry.description: When the Hunter makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

entry.name: Deathlock
entry.description: Spend a Fear to curse a target within Very Close range with a necrotic Deathlock until the end of the scene. Attacks made by the Hunter against a Deathlocked target deal direct damage. The Hunter can only maintain one Deathlock at a time.

entry.name: Inevitable Death
entry.description: Mark a Stress to spotlight 1d4 allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.

monster.name: Royal Advisor
monster.description: A high-ranking courtier with the ear of the local nobility.

entry.name: Devastating Retort
entry.description: A PC who rolls less than 17 on an action roll targeting the Advisor must mark a Stress.

entry.name: Bend Ears
entry.description: Mark a Stress to influence an NPC within Melee range with whispered words. That target’s opinion on one matter shifts toward the Advisor’s preference unless it is in direct opposition to the target’s motives.

monster.name: Secret-Keeper
monster.description: A clandestine leader with a direct channel to the Fallen Gods.
monster.motives: Amass great power, plot, take command

entry.name: Seize Your Moment
entry.description: Spend 2 Fear to spotlight 1d4 allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.

entry.name: Our Master’s Will
entry.description: When you spotlight an ally within Far range, mark a Stress to gain a Fear.

entry.name: Summoning Ritual
entry.description: Countdown (6). When the Secret-Keeper is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When they mark HP, tick down this countdown by the number of HP marked. When it triggers, summon a Minor Demon who appears at Close range.

monster.name: Shark
monster.description: A large aquatic predator, always on the move.
monster.motives: Find the blood, isolate prey, target the weak

entry.name: Terrifying
entry.description: When the Shark makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

entry.name: Rending Bite
entry.description: When the Shark makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

monster.name: Siren
monster.description: A half fish person with shimmering scales and an irresistible voice.
monster.motives: Consume, lure prey, subdue with song

entry.name: Captive Audience
entry.description: If the Siren makes a standard attack against a target Entranced by their song, the attack deals 2d10+1 damage instead of their standard damage.

monster.name: Spectral Archer
monster.description: A ghostly fighter with an ethereal bow, unable to move on while their charge is vulnerable.
monster.motives: Move through solid objects, stay out of the fray, rehash old battles

entry.name: Ghost
entry.description: The Archer has resistance to physical damage. Mark a Stress to move up to Close range through solid objects.

monster.name: Spectral Captain
monster.description: A ghostly commander leading their troops beyond death.
monster.motives: Move through solid objects, rally troops, rehash old battles

entry.name: Ghost
entry.description: The Captain has resistance to physical damage. Mark a Stress to move up to Close range through solid objects.

entry.name: Unending Battle
entry.description: Spend 2 Fear to return up to 1d4+1 defeated Spectral allies to the battle at the points where they first appeared (with no marked HP or Stress).

entry.name: Hold Fast
entry.description: When the Captain’s Spectral allies are forced to make a reaction roll, you can mark a Stress to give those allies a +2 bonus to the roll.

monster.name: Spectral Guardian
monster.description: A ghostly fighter with spears and swords, anchored by duty.
monster.motives: Move through solid objects, protect treasure, rehash old battles

entry.name: Ghost
entry.description: The Guardian has resistance to physical damage. Mark a Stress to move up to Close range through solid objects.

monster.name: Spy
monster.description: A skilled espionage agent with a knack for being in the right place to overhear secrets.
monster.motives: Cut and run, disguise appearance, eavesdrop

entry.name: Gathering Secrets
entry.description: Spend a Fear to describe how the Spy knows a secret about a PC in the scene.

monster.name: Stonewraith
monster.description: A prowling hunter, like a slinking mountain lion, with a slate-gray stone body.

entry.name: Stonestrider
entry.description: The Stonewraith can move through stone and earth as easily as air. While within stone or earth, they are Hidden and immune to all damage.

entry.name: Rocky Ambush
entry.description: While Hidden, mark a Stress to leap into Melee range with a target within Very Close range. The target must succeed on an Agility or Instinct Reaction Roll (15) or take 2d8 physical damage and become temporarily Restrained.

entry.name: Avalanche Roar
entry.description: Spend a Fear to roar while within a cave and cause a cave-in. All targets within Close range must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll (14) or take 2d10 physical damage. The rubble can be cleared with a Progress Countdown (8).

monster.name: War Wizard
monster.description: A battle-hardened mage trained in destructive magic.
monster.motives: Develop new spells, seek power, conquer

entry.name: Battle Teleport
entry.description: Before or after making a standard attack, you can mark a Stress to teleport to a location within Far range.

entry.name: Refresh Warding Sphere
entry.description: Mark a Stress to refresh the Wizard’s “Warding Sphere” reaction.

entry.name: Eruption
entry.description: Spend a Fear and choose a point within Far range. A Very Close area around that point erupts into impassable terrain. All targets within that area must make an Agility Reaction Roll (14). Targets who fail take 2d10 physical damage and are thrown out of the area. Targets who succeed take half damage and aren’t moved.

entry.name: Arcane Artillery
entry.description: Spend a Fear to unleash a precise hail of magical blasts. All targets in the scene must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 2d12 magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

monster.name: Adult Flickerfly
monster.description: A winged insect the size of a large house with iridescent scales and wings that move too fast to track.
monster.motives: Collect shiny things, hunt, nest, swoop

entry.name: Relentless (4)
entry.description: The Flickerfly can be spotlighted up to four times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Never Misses
entry.description: When the Flickerfly makes an attack, the target’s Evasion is halved against the attack.

entry.name: Deadly Flight
entry.description: While flying, the Flickerfly can move up to Far range instead of Close range before taking an action.

entry.name: Whirlwind
entry.description: Spend a Fear to whirl, making an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Flickerfly succeeds against take 3d8 direct physical damage.

entry.name: Mind Dance
entry.description: Mark a Stress to create a magically dazzling display that grapples the minds of nearby foes. All targets within Close range must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. For each target who failed, you gain a Fear and the Flickerfly learns one of the target’s fears.

entry.name: Hallucinatory Breath
entry.description: When the Flickerfly takes damage for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, the Flickerfly breathes hallucinatory gas on all targets in front of them up to Far range. Targets must make an Instinct Reaction Roll or become overwhelmed by fearful hallucinations. Targets whose fears are known to the Flickerfly have disadvantage on this roll. Targets who fail lose 2 Hope and take 3d8+3 direct magic damage.

monster.name: Demon Of Avarice
monster.description: A regal cloaked monstrosity with circular horns adorned with treasure.

entry.name: Money Talks
entry.description: Attacks against the Demon are made with disadvantage unless the attacker spends a handful of gold. This Demon starts with a number of handfuls equal to the number of PCs. When a target marks HP from the Demon’s standard attack, they can spend a handful of gold instead of marking HP (1 handful per HP). Add a handful of gold to the Demon for each handful of gold spent by PCs on this feature.

entry.name: Numbers Must Go Up
entry.description: Add a bonus to the Demon’s attack rolls equal to the number of handfuls of gold they have.

monster.name: Demon Of Despair
monster.description: A cloaked one-creature with long limbs, seeping shadows.
monster.motives: Make fear contagious, stick to the shadows, undermine resolve

entry.name: Depths of Despair
entry.description: The Demon deals double damage to PCs with 0 Hope.

entry.name: Your Struggle Is Pointless
entry.description: Spend a Fear to weigh down the spirits of all PCs within Far range. All targets affected replace their Hope Die with a d8 until they roll a success with Hope or their next rest.

entry.name: Your Friends Will Fail You
entry.description: When a PC fails with Fear, you can mark a Stress to cause all other PCs within Close range to lose a Hope.

monster.name: Demon Of Hubris
monster.description: A perfectly beautiful and infinitely cruel demon with a gleaming spear and elegant robes.
monster.motives: Condescend, declare premature victory, prove superiority

entry.name: Terrifying
entry.description: When the Demon makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range must lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

entry.name: Double or Nothing
entry.description: When a PC within Far range fails a roll, they can choose to reroll their Fear Die and take the new result. If they still fail, they mark 2 Stress and the Demon clears a Stress.

entry.name: Unparalleled Skill
entry.description: Mark a Stress to deal the Demon’s standard attack damage to a target within Close range.

entry.name: The Root of Villainy
entry.description: Spend a Fear to spotlight two other Demons within Far range.

monster.name: Demon Of Jealousy
monster.description: A fickle creature of spindly limbs and insatiable desires.
monster.motives: Join in on others’ success, take what belongs to others, hold grudges

entry.name: Unprotected Mind
entry.description: The Demon’s standard attack deals direct damage.

entry.name: My Turn
entry.description: When the Demon marks HP from an attack, spend a number of Fear equal to the HP marked by the Demon to cause the attacker to mark the same number of HP.

entry.name: Rivalry
entry.description: When a creature within Close range takes damage from a different adversary, you can mark a Stress to add a d4 to the damage roll.

monster.name: Demon Of Wrath
monster.description: A hulking demon with boulder-sized fists, driven by endless rage.
monster.motives: Fuel anger, impress rivals, wreak havoc

entry.name: Anger Unrelenting
entry.description: The Demon’s attacks deal direct damage.

entry.name: Battle Lust
entry.description: Spend a Fear to boil the blood of all PCs within Far range. They use a d20 as their Fear Die until the end of the scene.

entry.name: Retaliation
entry.description: When the Demon takes damage from an attack within Close range, you can mark a Stress to make a standard attack against the attacker.

monster.name: Dire Bat
monster.description: A winged pet endlessly loyal to their vampire owner.

entry.name: Flying
entry.description: While flying, the Bat gains a +3 bonus to their Difficulty.

entry.name: Screech
entry.description: Mark a Stress to send a high-pitch screech out toward all targets in front of the Bat within Far range. Those targets must mark 1d4 Stress.

monster.name: Dryad
monster.description: A nature spirit in the form of a humanoid tree.
monster.motives: Camouflage, drive out, preserve the forest

entry.name: Bramble Patch
entry.description: Mark a Stress to target a point within Far range. Create a patch of thorns that covers an area within Close range of that point. All targets within that area take 2d6+2 physical damage when they act. A target must succeed on a Finesse Roll or take more than 20 damage to the Dryad with an attack to leave the area.

entry.name: Group Saplings
entry.description: Spend a Fear to grow three Treant Sapling Minions, who appear at Close range and immediately take the spotlight.

monster.name: Elemental Spark
monster.description: A blazing mote of elemental fire.

entry.name: Minion (9)
entry.description: The Elemental is defeated when they take any damage. For every 9 damage a PC deals to the Elemental, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

monster.name: Greater Earth Elemental
monster.description: A living landslide of boulders and dust, as large as a house.

entry.name: Slow
entry.description: When you spotlight the Elemental and they don’t have a token on their stat block, they can’t act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they’re preparing to do. When you spotlight the Elemental and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

entry.name: Crushing Blows
entry.description: When the Elemental makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

entry.name: Immovable Object
entry.description: An attack that would move the Elemental moves them two fewer ranges (for example, Far becomes Very Close). When the Elemental takes physical damage, reduce it by 7.

entry.name: Rockslide
entry.description: Mark a Stress to create a rockslide that buries all the land in front of Elemental within Close range with rockfall. All targets in this area must make an Agility Reaction Roll (19). Targets who fail take 2d12+5 physical damage and become Vulnerable until their next roll with Hope. Targets who succeed take half damage.

monster.name: Greater Water Elemental
monster.description: A huge living wave that crashes down upon enemies.

entry.name: Water Jet
entry.description: Mark a Stress to attack a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal 2d4+7 physical damage and the target’s next action has disadvantage. On a failure, the target must mark a Stress.

entry.name: Drowning Embrace
entry.description: Spend a Fear to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Elemental succeeds against become Restrained and Vulnerable as they begin drowning. A target can break free, ending both conditions, with a successful Strength or Instinct Roll.

monster.name: Huge Green Ooze
monster.description: A translucent green mound of acid taller than most humans.

entry.name: Slow
entry.description: When you spotlight the Ooze and they don’t have a token on their stat block, they can’t act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they’re preparing to do. When you spotlight the Ooze and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

entry.name: Acidic Form
entry.description: When the Ooze makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

entry.name: Envelop
entry.description: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, the Ooze Envelops them and the target must mark 2 Stress. While Enveloped, the target must mark an additional Stress every time they make an action roll. When the Ooze takes Severe damage, all Enveloped targets are freed and the condition is cleared.

monster.name: Hydra
monster.description: A quadrupedal scaled beast with multiple long-necked heads, each filled with menacing fangs.

entry.name: Many-Headed Menace
entry.description: The Hydra begins with three heads and can have up to five. When the Hydra takes Major or greater damage, they lose a head.

entry.name: Relentless (X)
entry.description: The Hydra can be spotlighted X times per GM turn, where X is the Hydra’s number of heads. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Regeneration
entry.description: If the Hydra has any marked HP, spend a Fear to clear a HP and grow two heads.

entry.name: Terrifying Chorus
entry.description: All PCs within Far range lose 2 Hope.

monster.name: Monarch
monster.description: The sovereign ruler of a nation, unearthed in the privilege of tradition and wielding unmatched power in their domain.
monster.motives: Control vassals, destroy rivals, forge a legacy

entry.name: Execute Them!
entry.description: Spend a Fear per PC in the party to have the group condemned for crimes real or imagined. A PC who succeeds on a Presence Roll can demand trial by combat or another special form of trial.

entry.name: Crossguard
entry.description: Once per scene, mark a Stress to summon Tier X Minions, who appear at Close range to enforce the Monarch’s will.

monster.name: Stag Knight
monster.description: A knight with huge, majestic antlers wearing armor made of dangerous thorns.
monster.motives: Isolate, maneuver, protect the forest, weed the unwelcome

entry.name: From Above
entry.description: When the Knight succeeds on a standard attack from above a target, they deal 3d12+3 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

entry.name: Blade of the Forest
entry.description: Spend a Fear to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Knight succeeds against take physical damage equal to 3d4 + the target's Major threshold.

monster.name: Oak Treant
monster.description: A sturdy animated old-growth tree.
monster.motives: Hide in plain sight, preserve the forest, root down, swing branches

entry.name: Just a Tree
entry.description: Before they make their first attack in a fight or after they become Hidden, the Treant is indistinguishable from other trees until they next act or a PC succeeds on an Instinct Roll to identify them.

entry.name: Seed Barrage
entry.description: Mark a Stress and make an attack against up to three targets within Close range, pummeling them with giant acorns. Targets the Treant succeeds against take 2d10+5 physical damage.

monster.name: Treant Sapling
monster.description: A small, sentient tree sapling.
monster.motives: Blend in, preserve the forest, pummel, surround

entry.name: Minion (6)
entry.description: The Sapling is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Sapling, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

monster.name: Head Vampire
monster.description: A captivating undead dressed in aristocratic finery.
monster.motives: Create thralls, charm, command, fly, intimidate

entry.name: Terrifying
entry.description: When the Vampire makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

entry.name: Look Into My Eyes
entry.description: A creature who moves into Melee range of the Vampire must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, you gain 1d4 Fear.

entry.name: Feed on Followers
entry.description: When the Vampire is within Melee range of an ally, they can cause the ally to mark a HP. The Vampire then clears a HP.

entry.name: The Hunt Is On
entry.description: Spend 2 Fear to summon 1d4 Vampires, who appear at Far range and immediately take the spotlight.

monster.name: Vampire
monster.description: An intelligent undead with blood-stained lips and a predator’s smile.

entry.name: Draining Bite
entry.description: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal 4d physical damage. A target who marks HP from this attack loses a Hope and must mark a Stress. The Vampire then clears a HP.

monster.name: Vault Guardian Sentinel
monster.description: A dust-covered golden construct with boxy limbs and a huge mace for a hand.
monster.motives: Destroy at any cost, expunge, protect

entry.name: Kinetic Slam
entry.description: Targets who take damage from the Sentinel’s standard attack are knocked back to Very Close range.

entry.name: Box In
entry.description: Mark a Stress to choose a target within Very Close range to focus on. That target has disadvantage on attack rolls when they’re within Very Close range of the Sentinel. The Sentinel can only focus on one target at a time.

entry.name: Mana Bolt
entry.description: Spend a Fear to lob explosive magic at a point within Far range. All targets within Very Close range of that point must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 8d20 magic damage and are knocked back to Close range. Targets who succeed take half damage and aren’t knocked back.

monster.name: Vault Guardian Turret
monster.description: A massive hulking turret with reinforced armor and twelve piston-driven mechanical legs.
monster.motives: Concentrate fire, lock down, mark, protect

entry.name: Slow Firing
entry.description: When you spotlight the Turret and they don’t have a token on their stat block, they can’t make a standard attack. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they’re preparing to do. When you spotlight the Turret and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can attack.

entry.name: Mark Target
entry.description: Spend a Fear to Mark a target within Far range until the Turret is destroyed or the Marked target becomes Hidden. While the target is Marked, their Evasion is halved.

entry.name: Concentrate Fire
entry.description: When another adversary deals damage to a target within Far range of the Turret, you can mark a Stress to add the Turret’s standard attack damage to the damage roll.

monster.name: Vault Guardian Gaoler
monster.description: A boxy, dust-covered construct with thick metallic swinging doors on their torso.

entry.name: Blocking Shield
entry.description: Creatures within Melee range of the Gaoler have disadvantage on attack rolls against them. Creatures trapped inside the Gaoler are immune to this feature.

monster.name: Young Ice Dragon
monster.description: A glacier-blue dragon with four powerful limbs and frost-tinged wings.
monster.motives: Avalanche, defend lair, fly, freeze, defend what is mine, maul

entry.name: Relentless (3)
entry.description: The Dragon can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Rend and Crush
entry.description: If a target damaged by the Dragon doesn’t mark an Armor Slot to reduce the damage, they must mark a Stress.

entry.name: No Hope
entry.description: When a PC rolls with Fear while within Far range of the Dragon, they lose a Hope.

entry.name: Blizzard Breath
